refnamediv.refpurpose: utility intended to test how network losses affects speech quality in VoIP-based applications.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: &E; is a simple utility intended to test how network losses affects speech quality in VoIP-based applications. Experimenter can set up encoder, channel and decoder options, such as codec type, loss rate, bandwith and one of the packet loss suppression algorithm on the receiver side.

&E; consists of three parts. Encoder reads data from input file, encodes it with selected codec, packs data into RTP-packets. Channel obtains packets from encoder, emulates losses and delays and send packets to the next party. Decoder receives data from channel, performs packet loss concealment and decoding, then stores data into the output file.

A few words about channel emulator algorithms. Channel consists of two blocks: random loss emulator and bandwidth limitation emulator. The first can emulate random uncorrelated losses with -l option or losses modelled with markov chain. With the markov chain it's nessesary to define two options: --p10 which specifies packet loss probability (in percent) in the case when previous packet has not be lost, and --p00 which specifies the same in the case when previous packet has been lost as well. Bandwith limitation is emulated with leaky bucket algorithm. Implementation receives two options: --bucket-size in packets and --bandwidth in bits per second (bps) or packets per second (pps).

listitem.para: Specify input (referenced) file. File must be in .WAV format, and its sampling rate must be equal with codec sampling rate (8000 samples per second in most cases).
Specify codec name. Allowed codec names must be displayed with --list-codecs option.
Specify number of encoder frames per one RTP packet.
Specify speex encoder quality (obviously this option makes sence only with "speex" codec).
Specify channel loss rate (floating number from 0 to 100). Default value is 0.
Specify p00 parameter of the markov chain loss model (floating number from 0 to 100). Default value is 0.
Specify p10 parameter of the markov chain loss model (floating number from 0 to 100). Default value is 0.
Specify bucket size in the leaky bucket traffic shaping model.

Specify bandwidth in the leaky bucket traffic shaping model. Note that full size of the one RTP packet consists of these addends: IP header size (20 bytes), UDP header size (8 bytes), RTP header size (12 bytes) and payload size itself.
Display short emulation statistics: total packets sent, packets lost, packets received and the rate of lost packets during current emulation.
Define log level verbosity. Zero means "display nothing", six means "push detailed log on the stdout".

refsect1.title: EXAMPLES
refsect1.para: Get the output signal in the "real channel" with short stats at the end of emulation
refsect1.programlisting: $ emulator --input-file i.wav --codec speex/8000 --speex-quality 8 --fpp 8 \ > --loss 5 --bw 4.9kbps --bucket-size 10 \ > --plc smart --output-file o.wav --show-stats Emulation statistics total packets sent: 63 packets lost: 35 packets received: 28 loss percent: 55.56
